title.en: My Collaboration Works: Hideo Azuma Comics Masterpiece Selection

altTitles.ja: マイ・コラボレーション・ワークス吾妻ひでお コミカライズ傑作選

description.en:
You can finally read Shotaro Ishinomori x Hideo Azuma's
strongest collaboration work!

For those who have been humming "Moonlight Ring~♪ Moonlight Ring~♪", there is a nostalgic and illusory work known as "Suki! Suki!! Witch Sensei". ``Guruguru Medaman'',
the legendary special effects comedy that is enthusiastically supported by some enthusiasts, including ``Magical Chappie'' from the Toei Animation Majoko series, and the last TV anime series produced by Studio Zero. The famous "Star Child Chobin". A new edition of ``Hideo Azuma's Comicalization Masterpiece Selection My Collaboration Works'', which compiles the comicalized works of these popular programs, will be published in
a new edition!There are still attempts to turn TV programs into comics, but in the 1970s,

At a time when ordinary households still had little means of recording and storing TV programs, such publications were far more important than they are today. The four works included in this selection of masterpieces are all based on original works. It is said that there are still many Azuma fans who have never read Hideo Azuma's manga because it cannot be said to be 100% original.

At the beginning of the volume, there will be a color gravure consisting of illustrations including valuable "Guru Guru Medaman" design drawings, and at the end there will also be a special conversation with Makoto Aoyagi (Chairman of Shotaro Ishinomori Fan Club). If you miss this opportunity, this is a valuable book that you will never be able to get again!

☆☆☆ Features of this book ☆☆☆
1. Contains collaborative works by Shotaro Ishinomori and Hideo Azuma!
2. "Hoshi no Chobin" and "Guru Guru" ``Medaman'' faithfully reproduces the two-color color page!
3. At the beginning of the book, the "character design'', "cover when Animage Comics
was published'', and ``illustration drawn on the insert'' are included as gravure.
4. At the end of the book, there will be a commemorative conversation with Makoto Aoyagi, the chairman of Shotaro Ishinomori's fan club, who was familiar with those days.

▼ Main contents
◇ “Suki! Suki!! Witch Sensei” all 5 episodes
--TV Magazine (Kodansha) December 1971 issue ~ April 1972 issue
◇ “Star Child Chobin” all 4 episodes (*2 colors) (with color pages)
--TV Magazine (Kodansha) January to April 1974 issue
◇ "Chappy the Wizard" all 8 episodes
-- TV Magazine (Kodansha) May to December 1972 issue
◇ "Guru Guru Medaman" all Episode 6 (*Two color pages included)
-- Adventure King (Akita Shoten) September 1976 issue ~ February 1977 issue

*This book is based on "Suki! Suki!! Majo Sensei" published by Tokuma Shoten in 1981 Based on ``Hideo Azuma TV Anime Masterpiece Selection 1'' and "Magician Chappie:
Hideo Azuma TV Anime Masterpiece Selection 2'' (all 2 volumes), it will be published
as a new edition with illustrations and interviews that were not included in the book.

biography.en:
石森章太郎
Ishinomori Shotaro
==
Real name Onodera Shotaro. He was known as Ishimori Shotaro before 1986 when he changed his name to Ishinomori Shotaro.

While he was in high school, he made his debut with Nikyu Tenshi in Manga Shônen (1954). Like most of the Japanese artists, Ishimori was influenced by Tezuka Osamu. In 1956, he formed a coterie group with Akatsuka Fujio, Nagashima Shinji and Suzuki Mitsuaki. He moved to Tokyo after graduation, where he continued to work as a mangaka, starting with the war story Kaiketsu Harimao in 1959. Subsequently, he produced hit mangas such as the science fiction series Cyborg 009 (1964) and the historical series Sabu to Ichi Torimono Hikae (Big Comic, 1968-72). In the 1970s, Ishimori created metamorphosis manga such as Kamen Rider and in the 1980s, he became a pioneer of a new manga category. In 1989, he commenced working on a large series about the history of Japan, Manga Nihon no Rekishi, which remained unfinished due to the artist's death on January 28th, 1998 at the age of 60.

Ishinomori was nicknamed the 'King of Manga' and is considered one of the pioneers of modern manga. He was also one of the most productive creators, producing over 120,000 pages of artwork in thirty years. It's rumored that he drew over 500 pages in one month!
